alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 2:41AM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and strong winds expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph can reduce visibilities from blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slick road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. These hazardous conditions are expected to impact the Thursday morning commute as well.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations, slow down and allow extra time when traveling. practice your winter safety rules, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your car in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jefferson; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
